title: Which NFL teams should make trades before the deadline? Barnwell sizes up expectations for all 32
content: Could the Lions add help? Will the Jets trade stars? Should the Giants make any moves? Let's look at which teams might swing deadline deals.

title: Sources: Nats near deal to hire Butera as skipper
content: The Nationals are finalizing a deal to hire 33-year old Blake Butera as their new manager, sources told ESPN, which will make him the youngest skipper hired to the position in the major leagues in more than half a century.

title: Reaves' run rolls on as buzzer-beater lifts Lakers
content: Austin Reaves continued his dream week, adding to a 51-point performance and a 41-point game with a floater at the buzzer that rescued the Lakers.

title: Famed Jim Irsay collection to be sold at auction
content: The Irsay family will auction off the majority of the memorabilia collection owned by Jim Irsay -- a compilation of items for which the late Colts owner once said he was offered more than $1 billion.

title: Sources: Feds eye MLBPA venture over spending
content: Players Way was cited in an anonymous whistleblower complaint last November that triggered an ongoing criminal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office in Brooklyn.

title: Jays ride Yesavage's record 12 K's to cusp of title
content: Trey Yesavage set a World Series rookie record with 12 strikeouts, propelling the Blue Jays past the Dodgers 6-1 and moving them one win away from their first championship since 1993.

title: Dodgers' bats flail again, putting season on brink
content: The Dodgers' offense fell flat again, managing four hits while striking out 15 times in a 6-1 loss to the Blue Jays that put them in a 3-2 hole in the World Series.

title: La. governor: LSU AD won't select football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: Marchand steps away to help friend after tragedy
content: Brad Marchand is stepping away from the Panthers to help coach a junior hockey team in place of friend JP MacCallum, whose daughter died last week of cancer.

title: The comprehensive guide to the women's hoops season, including preseason picks
content: Who's winning the 2026 national title (UConn? UCLA? South Carolina? LSU?) and other preseason picks, predictions.

title: Storylines to watch in all 31 men's basketball conferences
content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: What we're hearing about the open Power 4 jobs and what comes next
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: Week 10 preview: Why Georgia's matchup with Florida just means more, plus key matchups
content: Key matchups and the story behind why Georgia quarterback Gunner Stockton really wants a win against Florida.

title: How Vanderbilt has gone from SEC doormat to CFP contender
content: After years of being a punching bag, coach Clark Lea and the 7-1 Commodores are showing plenty of fight.

title: 'I didn't even know he was a gambler': How the Blazers and NBA are grappling with Chauncey Billups' stunning downfall
content: The questions inside the Blazers' locker room and across the NBA are the same: How do we reconcile the man we thought we knew -- and a man the federal government believes is a criminal?

title: Inside Marcus Kowal's fight to change America's drunken driving laws
content: Marcus Kowal, an ex-MMA fighter, wants to change American drunken driving laws after the tragic death of his 15-month-old son.

title: Only four teams have made the playoffs after having a 1% chance. The Ravens think they'll be the fifth
content: If it's going to take 10 wins to clinch a playoff berth or the division, Baltimore will need to win eight of its next 10 games.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Playoff push: Trade targets and what to expect from murky RB rotations
content: What to make of backfield rotations, players on the rise and who to target as we approach the fantasy playoffs.

title: 'We've got to figure something out': Dodgers must start hitting -- or this World Series is over
content: A lineup full of All-Stars has looked off all postseason long -- and especially in the Fall Classic. Can L.A. fix it before it's too late?

title: The next generation of entertainers: 15 young stars lighting up Europe
content: Bill Connelly shines a spotlight on 15 under-21 players who have begun to make a name for themselves on Europe's biggest stages.

title: Let's project group favorites and the teams fighting for a wild-card spot
content: The third edition of the in-season tournament tips off on Friday. Let's take a look at who has the best chance to advance to Vegas in December.

title: HalloWemby: Will Victor Wembanyama continue his Halloween costume trend?
content: With no game on Halloween this season, the San Antonio Spurs center revealed there would be no costume -- but all eyes are on pregame.

title: 'Toughest player I've ever seen': The Legend of Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid's Vinícius Júnior eyes PSG
content: Vinícius Júnior's first choice if he were to leave Real Madrid would reportedly be Paris Saint-Germain. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: What we've learned: Arsenal's struggles; Spurs' defense impresses
content: The Women's Super League is through six games this season and returns after international break. But what have we learned so far?

title: Survivor pool strategy: Rams, Chargers among top options in Week 9
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 9, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Giannis is a one-man show this season
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Giannis Antetokounmpo, Nikola Jokic and other notables around the NBA this season.

title: Second flood warning issued at Prakasam Barrage in Vijayawada
content: Extremely heavy rainfall under the influence of Cyclone Montha triggers flash floods in the tributaries of the Krishna leading to rapid rise in inflows

title: SIT’s Sabarimala temple theft probe edges closer to serving and retired TDB officials
content: ADGP, Crime Branch and Law and Order, H. Venkatesh chairs meeting of SIT purportedly to plot the next phase of the probe, which may entail more arrests and confiscation of material objects pertaining to the case

title: Centre tells NGT it is aware of Great Nicobar project’s biodiversity impact, has mitigation plan
content: One petition, submitted by activist Ashish Kothari, challenges the clearances obtained for the project, citing violations of the Island Coastal Regulation Zone (ICRZ) notification, 2019 notification and inadequacies in the environmental impact assessment.

title: Every farmer affected by Cyclone Montha will get compensation, says Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan
content: As per preliminary estimates, crops in 1.38 lakh hectares have been damaged in the State, he says adding that advanced preparations and meticulous planning helped contain damages

title: Teachers protest MGU’s ‘chaotic’ scheduling amid rush for exam valuation
content: Teachers are forced to juggle multiple academic responsibilities while simultaneously attending valuation camps. University officials defend the move, asserting that the 90 working days also include the period allotted for examinations

title: Experts, academics call for conservation of Ganga ghats in Kolkata
content: They say rapid development and pollution are causing permanent damage to Ganga river front that defines Kolkata’s identity and country’s collective memory

title: Punjab farmer outfits ask government to withdraw stubble burning cases or face resistance
content: Farmers associated with over 30 farmer and farm labour unions under the banner of Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) have declared that they would hold demonstrations and submit memorandums to deputy commissioners in support of their demands on November 4

title: Public safety app by GHMC for proactive redressal of grievances
content: The mobile app enables the officials to record, update, and capture geo-tagged photos of the issues noticed directly from the field

title: APCC chief Sharmila urges Centre to declare Cyclone Montha a national calamity, release adequate aid
content: The Congress leader accuses Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of under-reporting the crop loss, and terms it a betrayal of farmers

title: Upalokayukta calls for early moral education to curb corruption
content: Veerappa was speaking after inaugurating an Anti-Corruption Awareness Week event at the district administration’s auditorium in Koppal

title: Ex-Gujarat IPS officer moves SC against HC order denying exemption from surrender in a 41-year-old case
content: The refusal to extend the exemption by Gujarat High Court on October 9 prompted a sessions court in Bhuj to issue a warrant for his arrest on October 10

title: Palakkad rail division opens studio for digital outreach
content: DRM says 80% work on the ₹22.22-crore pit line at Palakkad over. Once completed, it will enable the division to introduce new train services from Palakkad

title: Forest dept. trains staff to repair defunct solar fences in Kerala
content: Under Mission Solar Fence, 1,500 km of solar fence across the State has been repaired, making 2,000 km of fencing functional. Employees who received initial training, in turn, trained other officials in each forest division. The dept. plans to continue the mission

title: Students learn about law enforcement at Police Open House in Guntur
content: Students go around an exhibition showcasing modern policing techniques and equipment, including body-worn cameras, surveillance units and riot control gear

title: Bombay HC clears Manjrekar’s film for release, says ‘Shivaji Maharaj’ name cannot be monopolised
content: High Court refused Everest Entertainment’s plea to block the movie, citing six-month delay and ruling that copyright protects expression, not ideas or titles

title: KGMCTA warns of intensified stir over unmet demands
content: KGMCTA expresses dissatisfaction with the lack of discussion about their issues, including payment of pending salaries, during a Cabinet meeting, warning that dismissal of their legitimate concerns could lead to an indefinite strike.

title: TTD ghee adulteration case: SIT arrests close aide of former Chairman Y.V. Subba Reddy
content: Chinna Appanna, who is named Accused No. 24 in the case, has been sent to judicial remand by the ACB court in Nellore till November 11

title: Man gets death penalty for murdering son, family by setting room ablaze
content: Hameed set fire to the room in which his son and family were sleeping after bolting it from outside on March 18, 2022, following a property dispute

title: UP Man Kills Sister, Dumps Body 70 Km Away Over Money Dispute
content: In a shocking incident in Gorakhpur city, a man killed his sister, broke her limbs and disposed of her body nearly 70 km away in Kushinagar district over a money dispute, police said on Thursday.

title: 3 Killed, Over 1 Lakh Displaced After Cyclone Montha In Andhra Pradesh
content: Three people have been reported dead in Andhra Pradesh after Cyclone Montha made landfall in the state. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu has announced a financial aid of Rs 5 lakh for each victim's family.

title: Voter Roll Revision May Influence Over 100 Seats in Bihar Assembly Polls
content: A detailed constituency-wise analysis of Bihar's Special Summary Revision data, as of September 30, 2025, shows a statewide average drop of 4.88 per cent in the number of registered voters.

title: What Mumbai Hostage-Taker Rohit Arya Said In Chilling Video
content: A hostage crisis unfolded in Mumbai this afternoon, with the suspect circulating a video message that he had some children in his captivity.

title: Mumbai Hostage-Taker Dies After Standoff With Cops, 17 Children Rescued
content: Rohit Arya, the man accused of taking 17 children hostage in Mumbai's Powai area on Thursday, has died after being injured in an exchange of gunfire with police.

title: Opinion: Opinion | "Just Delhi By The Sea": How Goa Drove Its Tourists Away
content: Goa's sleepy and leisurely environment, once its greatest asset, is now its weakness.You can get WiFi on a surfboard in Bali, but still struggle to find a clean loo in Baga.

title: Rohini Acharya Aims At Hema Malini, Others In "Dancer" Row Return Fire
content: Lalu Yadav's elder daughter Rohini Acharya launched a counter-attack on the BJP after the ruling party made fun of RJD's Chapra candidate and Bhojpuri superstar Khesari Lal Yadav. He joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) only recently.

title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang 'Confident' Trump, Xi Had A Good Meeting
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Thursday he was confident that US President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping had a good conversation during a meeting in South Korea earlier in the day.

title: "Insult": BJP Complains To Poll Body On Rahul Gandhi's "PM Will Dance" Remark
content: The BJP has filed a complaint with the Election Commission against Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi over his remarks that Prime Minister Narendra Modi would do anything for votes, including dancing.

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan To Resume Peace Talks In Istanbul: Officials
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan are expected to resume peace talks in Istanbul to revive a dialogue that collapsed earlier this week, Pakistan's defence minister and state media in both countries said Thursday.

title: Russian Drone, Missile Strikes Trigger Power Outage Across Ukraine: Kyiv
content: The latest in a sustained Russian campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure brought power outages and restrictions in all the country's regions.

title: Russia Clarifies Its Tests Were Not 'Nuclear' After Trump Orders US Tests
content: Moscow on Thursday sought to cool rising nuclear tensions with Washington, after two tests of new Russian nuclear-capable weapons systems prompted US President Donald Trump to order his own nuclear tests.

title: India Confirms 6-Month Exemption From US Sanctions On Iran's Chabahar Port
content: American sanctions will not apply to India's Chabahar Port in Iran, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said today.

title: Turkish Rescuers Stranded As Israel Delays Approval To Enter Gaza
content: A Turkish disaster response team is still waiting by the Gaza border for Israeli approval to enter the Palestinian territory to help with search and rescue operations, a defence ministry source said Thursday.

title: Lebanon President Instructs Army To "Confront" Any Israeli Incursions
content: The Israeli military on Thursday carried out a deadly raid in southern Lebanon, prompting Lebanese President Joseph Aoun to order the army to confront such incursions.

title: Chargesheet Filed In Durgapur Gang Rape Case Within 20 Days
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has filed a chargesheet before the court within 20 days of the alleged gang rape of a medical student in West Bengal's Durgapur.

title: 5 More Arrested In Louvre Heist, Jewels Still Missing
content: Five more people have been arrested in the investigation into the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre Museum, but the treasures remain missing, the Paris prosecutor announced Thursday.

title: Phones To Get Verified Caller ID System Soon, No Internet Needed
content: India is gearing up to launch its own official caller ID system, where it will flash the registered name of the caller on your screen the moment your phone rings.

title: Researchers from Kerala identify a rare case of scrub typhus in a Dubai-returned man from Thiruvananthapuram
content: According to official figures, around thousand scrub typhus cases are reported each year in Kerala, 70% of which are from Thiruvananthapuram and the rest are from Kozhikode, Wayanad, Idukki and Kollam

title: Support price hike brings hope, but doubts linger in Kerala’s rubber heartland
content: Government  move to hike the support price of rubber from ₹180 to ₹200 per kg has sent a wave of optimism through central Travancore and the settler belts of north Malabar, where rubber trees still dominate the landscape

title: State attracted over ₹29,200 crore in investments in wind and solar sector since 2021: Minister
content: We aim to source 50% of our power requirement from renewable sources by 2030, 70% reduction in carbon emissions, and Net Zero by 2070, in line with India’s national commitments, says S.S. Sivasankar

title: Impact of betrayal on poll vows visible in Cong. actions in Jubilee Hills: KTR
content: ‘Azharuddin inducted into Cabinet to accommodate a minorities’ leader, 23 months after coming to power’

title: Offshore wind set to triple by 2030 despite U.S. slowdown, says report
content: In a rare climate success story, offshore wind is gaining global momentum, with Asia, Europe, and China driving a surge in capacity that could nearly meet climate targets by 2030, the Ember-GOWA report said

title: Innovation has to be mainstreamed in development paradigm: Mihir Shah
content: Panel discussion on ‘Local economic development – strategy and scoping’ as part of a joint national consultative group and bottom-up consultative group meeting on the ‘One Local Government One Idea’ (OLOI) programme of K-DISC

title: NMC urges medical colleges to join survey to assess mental health of students
content: The website – ntf.education.gov.in – will serve as a platform to collect different perspectives from college students, parents, faculty, mental health service providers, and institutions

title: SFI to continue agitation till KAU withdraws fee hike
content: Students protest across Kerala Agricultural University campuses demanding rollback of hike and NEP-linked reforms

title: Tech-driven preparedness helped reduce cyclone impact, loss at ₹5,265 crore, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister says all government departments worked in close coordination and managed to restore normalcy to a large extent on the very first day

title: Cyclone Montha aftermath: Minister Veeranjaneya Swamy inspects submerged areas
content: Government will provide compensation for damaged crops and financial assistance to the flood-affected as per guidelines, says the Social Welfare Minister

title: Brewery issue: Congress blocks Puthussery panchayat office
content: Congress alleges that the governing body, by agreeing to supply water to the brewery, has prioritised the brewery’s needs over those of local farmers who rely heavily on river water for agriculture

title: Chittapur RSS route march row: Karnataka High Court orders for another meeting on November 5 in Advocate-General’s office
content: The High Court of Karnataka directed the Kalaburagi district administration to hold one more meeting on November 5 on the issue of granting permission to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) to conduct its route march in Chittapur

title: LDF in Ernakulam to seek inputs from public to draft manifesto
content: LDF workers to visit houses and institutions in the district from November 1 to 3 and distribute a form to people to fill in their suggestions

title: Jan Suraaj Party supporter found dead under mysterious circumstances in Patna's Mokama
content: A large number of security personnel have been deployed in the area and an investigation is underway, the police said

title: Thripunithura set for a tight three-cornered contest
content: While LDF remains confident of returning to power with a stronger majority citing its development initiatives, BJP is optimistic about capturing power for the first time, with the state leadership set to lead the campaign. Despite its setbacks over the past decade, UDF remains hopeful of a comeback by fielding stronger candidates

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu to disburse pensions at Pedannavaripalli near Kadiri on November 1
content: Sri Sathya Sai district Collector Shyam Prasad and Superintendent of Police Satheesh Kumar inspect arrangements for the Chief Minister’s visit

title: NUALS joins hands with NACIN
content: The agreement aims to promote joint research, training, and academic exchange in areas such as customs law, GST, international trade law, and narcotics control

title: Kerala to have hub-and-spoke model diagnostic labs network
content: Around 1,300 laboratories under Health department part of Nirnaya project. These include over 200 ‘hub’ labs and around 1,100 ‘spoke’ labs across various districts

title: Energy Minister K.J. George inaugurates solar plant in Hoskote for farmers; Sharavati project vital for State’s future, he says
content: Minister says that the demand for power has surged from 9,000 MW to nearly 18,000 MW in the current term. ‘We managed uninterrupted supply through power exchange agreements with other States,’ he says

title: Punjab launches ‘The English Edge’ initiative
content: The initiative has been rolled out to empower three lakh students in Classes 9 to 12 across 500 government schools in Punjab, equipping them with confident speaking, reading, and thinking skills in English, Punjab Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains said

title: Librarians get help in enhancing their understanding of digital resource management
content: VTU hosts a Consortium Train the Trainer Programme on e-Resources for librarians on Jnana Sangama campus

title: ECI reviews security at inter-State borders ahead of Assembly polls in Bihar
content: The Commissioners reviewed law-and-order arrangements in Bihar and its neighbouring States to monitor movement of people, materials and money, including arms, anti-social elements, liquor, narcotics and freebies between States and across the international border with Nepal.

title: Launch ‘Naipunyam’ portal during CII Partnership Summit, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: Industries and educational institutions should be linked through the portal, which should also allow tracking of placements, says the Chief Minister

title: From waste to wonder: Lalur’s garbage hill reborn as I. M. Vijayan Sports Complex
content: Once the symbol of pollution and protest, Lalur trenching ground now stands transformed into a ₹46-crore sports complex named after Kerala’s football legend. It will feature a synthetic track, an indoor stadium, and a swimming pool

title: Justice Surya Kant appointed as 53rd Chief Justice of India
content: Justice Surya Kant will be the CJI for nearly 15 months, starting from November 24, and demit office on February 9, 2027 on attaining the age of 65 years.

title: Azharuddin’s induction into Cabinet violates election code: Telangana BJP
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: ‘Urbanisation posing challenges in Kozhikode’
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Inside Mumbai hostage scare: How cops stormed studio; what was accused's motive?
content: Young actor aspirants were held hostage at a Mumbai studio by a self-proclaimed filmmaker demanding to speak to certain individuals. Police successfully stormed the studio, rescuing 19 hostages, including 17 children, and apprehending the suspect. The motive is believed to be work-related dues, with the suspect appearing mentally unstable.

title: Racy clips & blackmail: Inside cold-blooded 'live-in murders'; what's pushing partners to kill?
content: Once a symbol of freedom, live-in relationships in India are now linked to chilling incidents of betrayal, violence, and death. From brutal murders to gruesome dismemberment, recent cases highlight a disturbing trend where possessiveness and jealousy escalate into extreme violence, challenging societal norms and legal interpretations.

title: US curbs on Russian crude: Will India & China stop buying? Why it's highly unlikely
content: US sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil are unlikely to halt Indian and Chinese crude purchases, though short-term disruptions are anticipated. While buyers reassess risk, direct purchases by non-US entities remain legally permissible, suggesting major export disruptions are improbable.

title: Google AI Pro plan worth Rs 35,100 free for Reliance Jio users: these users to get priority access
content: Reliance Industries and Google are joining forces. Eligible Jio users will receive 18 months of free Google AI Pro. This initiative aims to make artificial intelligence accessible to everyone in India. Young Jio 5G users aged 18 to 25 will be the first to benefit. The partnership also extends to enterprise AI solutions, empowering Indian businesses with advanced AI tools and infrastructure.

title: Former national tennis champion banned for two years; morphine found in dope test
content: Former national champion Dalwinder Singh has been banned for two years by the International Tennis Integrity Agency after testing positive for morphine. The 29-year-old admitted to the violation, attributing the substance to pain medication following wrist surgery. However, he failed to provide supporting evidence, leading to the suspension and forfeiture of his results.

title: Usha's Hindu faith helped JD find Christ again - what changed?
content: ​​For years, JD Vance sounded almost liberal about it — the man who once mocked religion in his twenties had become the poster boy for spiritual humility. He talked about her vegetarian cooking, her moral steadiness, her influence on his faith. “She encouraged me to reconnect with God,” he told friends and reporters.

title: Qantas exec resigns after cyberattack: CEO sends memo to employees; explains decision
content: Qantas CEO Vanessa Hudson announced a key executive departure, with Chief Customer and Digital Officer Catriona Larritt leaving by year-end. This triggers an immediate restructuring, reallocating responsibilities for brand, marketing, and cyber security. The changes aim to rebuild trust and operational resilience following a significant cyber breach impacting millions of customers.

title: Men call AI, data analytics masculine; gendered meritocracy exists; equality feels hollow
content: In a world that claims progress, bias has merely changed its form. A new Capgemini Research Institute report reveals that while women match men in confidence and capability, nearly half of male leaders still label AI and innovation skills as “masculine.” The patriarchy, it seems, has not vanished—it has simply learned to code.

title: Brother wins SC case over father’s house sale despite no will share
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that only a registered sale deed can transfer property ownership, not an unproven Will or GPA. This decision settled a decades-old family dispute, clarifying that informal documents cannot confer title. The court emphasized that a sale is valid only for the seller's lawful share, protecting other heirs' rights.

title: No Magnus Carlsen! D Gukesh to headline 2026 Masters lineup at 'Wimbledon of Chess'
content: The 88th Tata Steel Chess Tournament in Wijk aan Zee, from January 16 to February 1, 2026, boasts its youngest-ever lineup with an average age of 23. Featuring four top-10 and ten top-30 players, the event promises a dynamic battle for the title. This prestigious tournament continues to solidify Wijk aan Zee as a global chess hub.

title: AI’s next victim? Expert predicts Salesforce collapse; sparks debate
content: A prominent computer science professor predicts Salesforce will be the first major tech company disrupted by AI, sparking widespread debate. Experts argue AI's superior data handling capabilities and tailored solutions threaten traditional CRM models.

title: Vanessa Bryant’s family outing steals spotlight as Dodgers fall to Blue Jays
content: Vanessa Bryant and her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri were present at the Rogers Center for Game 5 of the 2025 World Series Championship, supporting the Los Angeles Dodgers against the Toronto Blue Jays. Despite the Dodgers' tough loss, the Bryant family's presence brought a bright spot to the stadium. They are devoted Dodgers fans, continuing Kobe Bryant's legacy.

title: Justice Surya Kant appointed as 53rd CJI; oath on Nov 24
content: Justice Surya Kant has been appointed as the 53rd Chief Justice of India. He will formally take oath on November 24, succeeding Chief Justice Bhushan Gavai, and will become the first top justice from Haryana.

title: CBSE Board Exam 2026: Dates announced; check full schedule
content: CBSE has released the final schedule for Class 10 and 12 board examinations 2026, starting February 17, 2026, at 10:30 AM (IST). The tentative schedule was earlier released on September 24, 2025. The final date sheet considers student subject combinations, entrance exam dates, and teacher availability, ensuring no clashes. Students, teachers, and schools can now plan preparations, evaluations, and logistics in advance. The complete timetable is available for download on the official CBSE website.

title: 'US behind China but will catch up': Bessent after Trump orders nuclear weapons testing
content: President Trump ordered the immediate resumption of nuclear weapons testing, ending a 33-year moratorium, citing China's advancements. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended the move as crucial for America to "catch up" with China's nuclear power development. The announcement preceded high-stakes trade talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Mumbai hostage crisis ends: Kidnapper dies of bullet injuries, had shot at cops; 19 rescued
content: A man, identified as Rohit Arya, took 19 people, including 17 children, hostage in a Mumbai flat on Thursday. Arya died in a police crossfire after threatening to harm himself and the children. All children were safely rescued, and police suspect work-related dues as the motive.

title: 'Already a subject of public ridicule': Red Chillies on Wankhede’s defamation suit
content: Red Chillies Entertainment argues that IRS officer Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against its Netflix series "The Bads of Bollywood" is "misconceived." The production house stated the show is situational satire, does not name Wankhede, and that his reputation was already damaged by a CBI FIR prior to its release.

title: IPL: Abhishek Nayar named KKR head coach; replaces Chandrakant Pandit
content: Abhishek Nayar has been appointed as the new head coach of Kolkata Knight Riders, succeeding Chandrakant Pandit. Nayar, a long-standing member of the KKR setup since 2018, brings progressive coaching methods and a player-centric philosophy to the role. He will work alongside mentor Dwayne Bravo as KKR embarks on its next phase.

title: TTP dy chief dead: Amjad killed in cross-border fire; Pak PM hails troops
content: Pakistan's security forces killed Amjad, the TTP's second-in-command and a high-value target, along with three other militants during an foiled infiltration attempt from Afghanistan into Bajaur district. President Zardari and Prime Minister Sharif lauded the operation, emphasising Pakistan's commitment to defeating elements harming innocent people.

title: Chess boom continues! 16-year-old Ilamparthi AR becomes India’s 90th Grandmaster
content: Chennai's 16-year-old Ilamparthi AR has become India's 90th Grandmaster, achieving his final norm at the Bijeljina Open. He previously secured norms in Vietnam and Singapore, crossing the 2500 Elo mark. Nurtured by Velammal School and supported by initiatives, Ilamparthi trains under Viswanathan Anand's academy.

title: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson’s longtime girlfriend stays low-key as he fights injury
content: Lamar Jackson, the Baltimore Ravens' two-time MVP quarterback, maintains a private personal life with his long-term girlfriend, Jaime Taylor, whom he met in high school. The couple, who share a daughter named Milan, prioritize privacy amidst Jackson's high-profile NFL career. Taylor has spoken about learning resilience from Jackson's approach to criticism and external noise.

title: Bihar polls: Owaisi raises Muslim leadership demand; will it dent MGB's prospects?
content: Speaking at an election rally in Kishanganj on Wednesday, Owaisi referred to VIP chief Vikas Sahani and said that if a leader from the Malla community can be projected for the deputy chief minister's post, then a leader from the Muslim community can also aim for the positions of Chief Minister and even Prime Minister.

title: ‘Main kyu gaali khaun’: Nitin Gadkari orders QR codes on highway sites
content: The road transport ministry is leveraging social media for highway project transparency. NHAI and builders will now upload construction videos on YouTube for public feedback. QR codes on national highways will display contractor and official details, ensuring accountability for road quality. This initiative aims to enhance public participation and deliver international-standard roads.

title: Financial rules shake-up in Nov: From bank deposits to pension deadlines — details
content: New banking regulations starting November 1, 2025, will allow up to four nominees for bank accounts and safety lockers. SBI Card is also updating its fee structure for education payments and wallet reloads. Additionally, PNB is reducing locker rent, and government pensioners have extended deadlines for life certificate submissions and NPS transitions.

title: Big diplomatic win: India gets 6-month waiver from US sanctions on Chabahar port
content: The US has granted India a six-month exemption from sanctions on the Chabahar port, a significant diplomatic achievement amidst ongoing trade deal negotiations. This development allows India to continue its investments and strategic access to Afghanistan and Central Asia. India is also analysing the implications of US sanctions on Russian oil companies, prioritising energy security for its population.

title: Stefon Diggs linked to Drake’s ‘Kiki’ pregnancy amid Cardi B baby claims
content: A shocking rumour has emerged concerning NFL star Stefon Diggs.  While Cardi B is confirmed to be pregnant with his child, DJ Akademiks alleges Diggs also got K'yanna Barber pregnant. Barber is famously known as 'Kiki' from Drake's hit song 'In My Feelings'. This news has sparked widespread online discussion and memes.

title: Bucks vs Warriors preview: Schedule, lineup, injuries and prediction
content: Basketball fans, brace yourselves for a thrilling NBA clash as the Golden State Warriors face the Milwaukee Bucks on October 30, 2025. The Warriors, with stars like Stephen Curry, will meet the Bucks, featuring Myles Turner and AJ Green.  Giannis Antetokounmpo's status is questionable, but the Bucks are coming off a strong win.  Tune in to see which team dominates.

title: F-1 visa and EAD renewal: Jobs at risk; what Indian students need to know
content: The United States has ended the automatic work permit extensions for some immigrants. This new rule, effective October 30, 2025, requires stricter checks before employment authorisations are renewed. International students on OPT, including STEM extensions, will be significantly impacted. They must stop working if their permit expires before renewal approval, creating potential job gaps and income loss.

title: US sanctions on Russian oil firms: MEA defends imports; why Trump hailed India
content: India is carefully reviewing the impact of new US sanctions on Russian oil companies. The nation reiterated its commitment to securing affordable energy for its 1.4 billion people, prioritising national interests and diverse sourcing. Meanwhile, US President Donald Trump said India's been "very good" in efforts to reduce Russian oil imports.

title: Bank holidays in November: Check complete state-wise list
content: Banks across India will observe multiple holidays in November 2025, impacting physical operations due to various national, regional, and cultural festivals. While digital services remain active, customers are advised to consult the RBI's state-specific holiday list for in-person banking plans. Key observances include Kannada Rajyothsava, Guru Nanak Jayanti, and Meghalaya's Wangala Festival.

title: IND vs AUS: Tragic! Why are players wearing black armbands?
content: Australia won the toss and chose to bat first in the Women's World Cup semifinal against India. Both teams wore black armbands in memory of 17-year-old Ben Austin, who tragically died after being hit by a cricket ball. This gesture highlighted the unity and empathy between the cricketing nations beyond the competition.

title: 8th Pay Commission: How will the new salary levels be calculated? Explained
content: 8th Pay Commission salary hike news: Central government employees and pensioners anticipate higher salaries and pensions as the 8th Pay Commission's Terms of Reference are approved. The commission will submit its report in 18 months, with recommendations likely effective from January 1, 2026.

title: Casey Prather net worth: Cal Bruton’s bold take fuels fresh MVP buzz
content: Brisbane Bullets import Casey Prather is being lauded by NBL champion Cal Bruton. Bruton stated Prather should be in the MVP conversation. Prather is second in league scoring and has shown remarkable consistency. His career-best form is a significant accomplishment. Prather's game includes rebounding, defense, and a strong offensive skillset.

title: IPL trade: MI shut down Rohit-to-KKR rumours in SRK style - 'Mushkil hi nahi...'
content: Mumbai Indians playfully dismissed rumors of Rohit Sharma joining Kolkata Knight Riders with a Shah Rukh Khan dialogue. This followed KKR's announcement of Abhishek Nayar as coach, a known friend and former trainer of Sharma. The article highlights Sharma's dedicated fitness regime and skill refinement, leading to his stellar performance in recent ODIs.

title: Shilpa Shetty’s mother Sunanda Shetty admitted to Lilavati hospital
content: Shilpa Shetty rushed to Lilavati Hospital after her mother, Sunanda Shetty, was admitted. Fans expressed support online. Sunanda’s hospitalisation followed Shilpa withdrawing her overseas travel plea amid a ₹60-crore fraud case. Professionally, Shilpa judged a dance show, while Raj Kundra debuted on reality TV’s The Traitors.

title: 'Can't break deal': Pak says 'US drones behind Afghan strikes'; makes shocking admission
content: Pakistan has admitted to a US drone agreement during Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks, causing Afghan negotiators to demand written guarantees against drone use in their airspace. The talks collapsed as Pakistan blamed Kabul for refusing to act against militants, with Islamabad vowing to protect its people from terrorism.

title: India-US trade deal: MEA shares update after Trump's hint at imminent pact
content: India and the US are continuing discussions to finalize a trade deal, with US President Trump hinting at an imminent agreement. The proposed deal reportedly includes reducing US tariffs on Indian exports and India decreasing Russian oil imports while increasing energy purchases from the US.

title: 'Timed for Trump visit, planned pan-India stir': Delhi police on 2020 riots case
content: Delhi Police opposed bail for Umar Khalid and others in the 2020 riots UAPA case, citing chats about Donald Trump as evidence of a pre-planned, pan-India conspiracy. The affidavit claims the plot aimed to attract international media attention and portray the CAA as a pogrom against Muslims, leading to 53 deaths and property damage.

title: What makes air you breathe thick and what makes it toxic
content: A new study reveals open fires account for over 50% of Delhi's particulate matter pollution, causing visible smog. However, transport and industry are major sources of toxic gases like benzene, contributing to invisible chemical toxicity. Addressing both requires distinct strategies for cleaner air.

title: The story behind UAE Flag Day: Why November 3 matters
content: UAE Flag Day, celebrated annually on November 3, marks the accession of Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan as President in 2004. Established in 2013, the day honors national unity, leadership, and pride. Citizens and residents raise the UAE flag simultaneously, sing the national anthem, and display flag colors, celebrating the country’s history, values, and the sacrifices of previous generations.

title: Ancient Antarctic ice reveals how Earth once heated and what it means today
content: Scientists have discovered the oldest directly dated ice and air on Earth in East Antarctica, dating back six million years. This ancient ice, found near the surface, offers unprecedented insights into Earth's past climate, revealing significantly warmer temperatures and higher sea levels. The findings provide crucial context for understanding modern global warming by showcasing natural climate fluctuations.

title: ‘I paid them all’: Ex-BPCL CFO claims he had to bribe Bengaluru officials after daughter's death
content: A former BPCL CFO alleged he was forced to pay bribes for services related to his daughter's death, from ambulance arrangements to obtaining official documents. Sivakumar K detailed his experience on LinkedIn, highlighting the open demands for bribes and questioning the fate of the poor. Bengaluru police have intervened and assured action.

title: Trump says talks with Xi 'tremendous success'; critics say it was a 'dud'
content: a partial de-escalation of trade hostilities, the united states and china announced several tentative agreements on Thursday . the detente followed the first face-to-face meeting between president Donald Trump and Xi Jinping in six years . he rated the meeting a "12" out of 10, stating an "outstanding group of decisions" were made .

title: Packers' 1923 throwbacks, Commanders' 'Super Bowl era' threads top Week 9 uniforms
content: the Packers and Washington Commanders are the latest teams to debut throwback threads . the threads include a brown, hand-painted helmet meant to emulate the vintage leather look of the league's earliest helmets. the navy blue jerseys are designed with dark gold numbers and stripes on the shoulder, with tan pants .

title: Ranking the top 50 NHL prospects: Who follows Schaefer, Demidov?
content: the Islanders lead the list with five in my top 50, followed by the blackhawks, sharks and mammoth with four apiece . no. 1 draft pick Matthew Schaefer is the only defenseman in NHL history to record a point in his first five games .

title: Pushed to the periphery, Nwaneri seizes his chance to shine for Arsenal
content: Ethan Nwaneri is still only 18 and has had to wait for a moment like this . the 18-year-old was one of arsenal's breakthrough stars of last season . but fortunes have conspired to complicate his continued involvement in the first team .

title: Edgecombe overtakes Flagg as ROY favorite; what it means for betting, fantasy
content: VJ Edgecombe ( +110 ) has officially surpassed Cooper Flagg ( +115 ) as the favorite to win the NBA's Rookie of the Year, according to ESPN BET . he is off to an amazing start, averaging 22.3 PPG, 5.8 RPG, 5.5 APG, 3.0 3PG and 1.5 SPG through his first four games while helping the Philadelphia 76ers to a surprising 4-0 start .

title: Timeline of past century's major pro sports gambling scandals
content: the rocky marriage of team sports and illicit gambling dates back more than a century in the united states . no major professional sport appears immune to gambling scandals, as the following partial timeline suggests . a gambling scandal at the City College of New York involved players who at thursday's game-fixing scandal .

title: Class rankings: Texas Tech climbs; fallout from firings continues
content: the player rankings update helped classes at Texas Tech, Indiana and Minnesota climb . the bigger picture to watch is how the slew of current and potential job openings will impact the class rankings . classes at Florida and LSU bring a great deal of intrigue as they are ranked inside the top 15 .

title: How Yesavage met the moment and pushed the Dodgers to the brink
content: Trey Yesavage hits out 12 in a showtopping performance for the blue Jays vs. the Dodgers . the 22-year-old right-handed rookie was under attack during game 5 of the world series . his first game this season came in April for Single-A Dunedin .

title: ⬇ CFB Bottom 10: Hot seats get hotter
content: "Take this job and shove it I ain't working here no more My woman done left And took all the reasons I was working for You better not try to stand in my way" a-walking out the door "Take This Job and Shove It," Johnny Paycheck Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, located behind the wall of industrial-sized cooling fans used to keep Pete Thamel's phone and laptop from overheating .
